The product of the lower triangular portion of x (including the diagonal) times its own transpose; that is, if L is a matrix of the same dimensions as x with L(m,n) equal to x(m,n) for n ≤ m and L(m,n) equal to 0 if n > m, the result is the symmetric matrix L L . This is a specialization of tcrossprod(x) for lower-triangular matrices.
